question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable when possible. I want to create a desktop BI analysis software. Could you help me generate one that can import Excel files, properly map the imported fields, and automatically generate BI analysis reports?

checklist.title: Is the Excel import functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Verify that the code can handle various Excel file formats (XLS, XLSX, CSV), supports multiple sheets, and properly manages data types during import (numbers, dates, text, etc.). Check for error handling for corrupted files, large datasets, and character encoding issues. Score 0 if import is not implemented, 5 if basic import exists with limitations, and 10 if the implementation is robust with comprehensive error handling.

checklist.title: Is the data field mapping system fully developed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements an intelligent field mapping system that can auto-detect data types, suggest appropriate mappings, and allow manual overrides. Check for data cleansing capabilities, handling of missing values, and validation of mapped fields. Deduct 3 points if automatic field type detection is missing, 3 points if there's no data preview functionality, and 4 points if field relationship detection is absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the BI analysis functions comprehensive and appropriate?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes essential BI analysis capabilities: descriptive statistics, trend analysis, correlation analysis, outlier detection, and predictive modeling. Verify that the analysis methods match the data types (categorical vs. numerical). Deduct 2 points for each missing core analysis function. Give 10 points if all essential analyses are implemented with appropriate algorithms and statistical validations.

checklist.title: Does the report generation system provide meaningful insights?
checklist.description: Assess whether the automatic report generation system produces actionable insights rather than just raw data. Check if it includes anomaly highlighting, trend identification, key metric summaries, and comparative analysis. Verify that reports can be customized and saved in multiple formats (PDF, HTML, etc.). Deduct 3 points if insights are not highlighted, 3 points if export options are limited, and 4 points if report templates are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as out-of-memory errors with large datasets, unexpected input values, application crashes). Check for proper exception handling, graceful degradation, and data recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should provide meaningful error messages and recovery paths, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered insight generation 2. Natural language query interface 3. Automatic dashboard recommendations based on data patterns 4. Real-time collaboration features). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant analysis calculations that could be optimized 2. Function modules unrelated to BI analytics (e.g., unnecessary multimedia features) 3. Resource-intensive visualizations that don't contribute to data understanding. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/analysis/visualization layers), unit test coverage, and performance optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if global state management is poorly implemented; deduct 3 points if the code lacks comments and documentation; deduct 2 points if there's no consideration for memory management with large datasets. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the UI follows modern data visualization principles: 1) Consistent data visualization style 2) Clear information hierarchy with proper emphasis on key metrics 3) Appropriate use of white space and grid alignment 4) Color schemes that account for data types and accessibility. Deduct 3 points for cluttered dashboards, 3 points for improper chart selection for data types, and 4 points for poor readability of data labels and values. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the interactive elements enhance data exploration: 1) Filtering and drill-down capabilities respond within 300ms 2) Smooth transitions between different views and analyses 3) Intuitive interactions for data selection and comparison. Deduct 3 points for laggy visualizations with large datasets, 3 points for unintuitive interaction patterns, and 4 points if essential interactions (zoom, filter, details-on-demand) are missing. The full score is 10 points.
